Collection.name: Records
Collection.type: Eamon.ThirdParty.BTree`1[[Eamon.Framework.IEffect, Eamon, Version=1.4.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null]], Eamon, Version=1.4.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Ali suddenly starts, and eyes you with more respect. "You are the one whom the master awaits," he says, "Come!" And with that word, you are gently wafted off the floor, and the two of you float upwards into the smoke canopy above.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Tokas' familiar voice fills your head, though he does not move, and you hear no sound: "You have come at last! Almost had I come to despair that you would arrive in time! The situation is most desperate.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Know you this: Lumen, the patron god of the city, has been cast down and totally destroyed by his ancient enemy, a god of evil whose name is not spoken, for he will hear his name, and will answer the call.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: It is the work of the nameless god that you see in the darkness that seals the city. The people quake in fear, for it will be but a matter of time before we shall be hauled down into darkness and unending torment.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Other gods, unfriendly to the nameless, have taken Lumen's things into their keeping in the hope that a champion will appear who has the wit and worth to win the trappings of a god, and banish the nameless to the pit whence he came.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: I myself am working in trance to hold the nameless at bay as best I can. I do not know of a champion who may better attain my goals than yourself - go now; I have informed the gods of your arrival, and you have their blessing."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The gardener chuckles, and says, "We've had a plague of basilisks this year, since things went powerful bad, so the young master's went and had these here cocks put in the yard."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Once you have descended, Ali murmurs to you, "Remember this: Lumen was protector of the people of this city, and the gods revere his memory. If you would assume his role, then you would fare better to wrong no one under your protection."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Now you know that smell! It is the rank odor of a cockatrice, a beast that turns its prey to stone with a glance! Waves of weakness wash over you; the beast must see you even now, though you must be just barely beyond its range.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The sign says, "We have in stock a small supply of blessed god-cloth for those holy needs of the devout! Light handling paraphernalia of all kinds. Gloves our specialty!"

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The pawnbroker tells you that he only has one decent weapon for sale, an iron sword. He has some other weapons, but frankly warns you that they are junk and not fit to see battle.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: He tells you that he will need a model to work from in order to make the mold that you require.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The glassblower tells you that he will need a mold in which to cast the sword. He adds that he doesn't do moldmaking.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The apothecary tells you that he will require that you supply the glass and silver nitrate, for he has neither item in stock.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The carpenter reflects on your request, and comments, "A wooden sword, is it? You'll be wanting a thick blade for more strength, I'll wager; it won't take an edge, neither. I know just what you'll be needing!"

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The tailor looks upon you with respect bordering upon reverence, and perhaps a tinge of hope, also. He hurriedly takes up his tools and begins the cutting and stitching.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The glassblower looks unhappy and tells you that he can supply you with plate glass, but he lacks the knowledge of the alchemiste that is required to silver a mirror.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The smith tells you that he lacks the knowledge of the alchemiste needed to make mirrors, but he would be happy to create a polished silver shield that would serve as well as a glass mirror, and would be unbreakable, also.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The smith frowns, and tells you that he doesn't sell bulk silver, but would be happy to make something for you.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The wooden mold bursts into flame when the molten glass is poured into it! The glassblower jumps back and says, "I did not think that it would work, and I was right! You'll have to supply a mold of a more refractory material!"

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The leatherworker points out to you that the straps aren't of much worth without something to attach them to - "Give me the object that you would use for your shield, and I will mount the straps for you at no extra charge!"

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: With a clear, bell-like tone, the glass sword snaps across with the first blow, and shatters into a thousand pieces!

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You note that one statue carries a large glass mirror, holding it at the edges. Apparently a failed attempt to reflect the cockatrice's gaze, the fool forgot his exposed fingers!

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "When the walls confound you, remember these words: 'Reverence brings out virtuous greatness within you' Once their beginnings are found you will prosper."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: As you come closer to the cockatrice, the strength of its gaze increases! You can see it now, hissing its defiance! Strangely, you do not hear anything, even though it is fairly near now.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: As you plunge the glass sword into the light warrior, the white light of its being bursts into a brilliant rainbow that illuminates the room with glorious colors. When the flash dies away, it is no more.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The hammer smashes the glass warrior into a thousand pieces! Shards of glass are hurled in a thick spray far out into the fires. It is totally destroyed.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The blue light cuts the shadow warrior into pieces as you thrust deep into its vitals. As darkness is the absence of light, so the presence of the blue light in the shadow warrior's vitals banishes it into nothingness.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The drug-crazed guards, seeing that you show proper reverence for the blessed shoes, relax their belligerent posture, and step aside.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: A priest cries out, "Hail to thee, shoes! Wearer of feet, which came to us from chaos, to lighten our hearts and uplift our soles!"

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: A priest cries out, "Oh, wondrous shoes, ultimate cavities, surrounders of feet! Hail, oh wondrous, battered buskins!"

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: A priest cries out, "We adore thee! We adore thee! We worship thee in the fullness of thy shoeness! Oh, magnificent footgear! Supreme notion of shoes! Hail!"

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You feel a tremendous electric potential build as you lay the blue light across the working surface of the anvil.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: A tremendous crash of thunder rocks the tiny room, and lightning flashes beneath the silver hammer! An incredible surge of energy flows into your body! The blue light grows in intensity!

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Again thunder crashes forth! Lightning bolts flash in all directions, hitting the walls, and even your body! As the blue light shines like a blue sun, you know that you have completed the tests, and have become a god!

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The townspeople gape in wonder and in hope, and one by one they fall to their knees! They offer up their prayers, and you feel stronger!

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The townspeople gape in wonder and in hope, and one by one they fall to their knees, and offer up their prayers!

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The stableboy grins, and says, "Surely! Shovel out the manure, and I will pay you 20 gold pieces. A bit of charisma lost to the stink, or hardiness to a strained back, would do your humility a good turn, I'll wager."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The astrologer consults his star charts. He says, "I see in your future a white light bursting into a thousand colored fragments when pierced by a triangular glass sword."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The astrologer consults his star charts. He tells you, "I see in your future, glass bursting into a thousand shards as it is struck a mighty hammer blow."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The astrologer consults his star charts. He tells you in a puzzled voice, "I see a chicken in your future."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The astrologer consults his star charts. He tells you, "I see in your future a tiny silver mallet, the blows of which will bring fulfillment!"

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The astrologer consults his star charts. He tells you, "I see in your future a holy white pouch, filled with the gods' own keys by your own gloved hand." He looks at you in awe.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The astrologer consults his star charts. He tells you, "I see a stone statue in your future. Heed well what it will tell you."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The astrologer warmly thanks you for the commission, but regrets to inform you that he will need some time to consult the stars and to prepare the forecast. He asks you to come back later.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Once you don the gauntlet, you begin to feel strange sensations as it grows up your arm, turning from black to blue as it grows! Soon you are encased in blue armor!

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The pawnbroker looks at you sharply, and says, "I am no great temple-goer, but I will tell you this: holy artifacts have no place in a shop such as mine. You may keep it."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: As the pawnboker reaches to pick up the star wand, he cries out as his hand is burned. He starts as he recognizes the wand, then falls to his knees and says to you, "Save us, lord!"

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The shopkeeper tells you that he doesn't need any help right now. "But try the stables," he remarks. "They're always needing someone to clean the stalls, if you don't mind losing your friends with the smell, and ruining your back!"

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: His glass sword is uniquely shaped: long and wickedly pointed, but edgeless. Being triangular in cross-section like a prism, it breaks the light from the flames into thousands of multicolored fragments.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "..d then the lord Lumen took the shaft of blue light; with his own hands he forged it into the weapon of a god, for it is written that none but the wielder of su..."

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You hesitate, and then change your mind, deciding not to squander any of your meager funds on something that you have no use for.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The shopkeeper smiles, "Yes, I deal in that product; but you must be more specific concerning your desires. Lest you would purchase my entire shop!" He chuckles.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: He looks at you with hard eyes, and says, "I do not deal in stolen property. This is an honest shop. I do not care for your company; if you have any honest business to transact, then be about it, and then be on your way!"

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: As you withdraw the wooden plug, you can see that the reservoir is empty. You turn it upside-down, and a single drop of rancid oil appears at the lip of the opening. Your nose tells you that it is red-herring oil.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The nameless, seeing that he is undone, flees in his dismay for the cliff edge, with you in hot pursuit, and he throws himself into the abyss. Full of defeat and pain, he will not again trouble the city for many a year. You have won!

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: outer guardsmen

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: drug-crazed spearmen

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: LARGE OVEN.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: This was to be my first Eamon that did not undergo massive changes; I intended it to be a straight version 6.2 dungeon with some extra commands added.*061

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You can imagine my chagrin when "out of memory" appeared with the program only 95% written.*062

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: It then became necessary to turn to the "hack-and-slash" school of programming: everything not essential was deleted. I also shortened several variable names ("ROOM" to "RO", "AD%()" to "A%()", and so on).*063

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: I am beginning to suspect that I may be incapable of writing an Eamon without stirring things up with an axe!@@PB**064

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: There are a number of new commands:*065

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Pray & Enter: Self explanatory.*066

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Earn: Meant to be a last-ditch way to pick up more cash. Beware! The gold you earn is not free, but costs you dearly!*067

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Buy: Informs a shopkeeper what you wish to purchase, including items that are not in the descriptions. You may even have certain items made for you.*068

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Pay: Actually purchases the item that was identified by the "Buy" cmd.*069

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Sell: Can be used to raise some money to "Buy" things with.@@PB**070

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The "Look" cmd will not find any secret passages or artifacts for you. Its only use is to re-examine room descriptions. However, there are artifacts embedded in room descriptions to be found using the "Examine" cmd.*071

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Other modifications to standard commands will become apparent during play.@@PB**072

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Among the many items you may purchase are forecasts from the astrologer. These are hints that might help you if you get stuck. Since they are hints, I would suggest that you try solving the puzzles without them, for your **073

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: own satisfaction and to save money. Be frugal! This advice is not cheap, and you will need a *minimum* of 190 GP to complete the quest.*074

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: A recurring puzzle is to determine what kind of weapon will destroy certain supernatural opponents, so watch the hit results closely, and think hard about which shops could supply you with an appropriate weapon. For **075

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: example: think about what you could make a sword from that might damage a creature made from light.@@PB**076

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The maze may seem insoluble, being made up of 36 rooms and a real pain to map, but it is not; a powerful hint is given in one place. Watch for it.*077

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: It may seem like you can't die in this adventure. Let me assure you that you *can* die at the hands of any of your enemies.*078

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Don't worry about losing your "big gun" weapons, or your gold. You will have the opportunity to recover everything before you return to the Main Hall.@@PB**079

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Readers of Roger Zelazny will recognize a close resemblance between Lumen and the main character of his "Creatures Of Light And Darkness": Sun-Eyed Set, destroyer of suns.*080

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: They will also notice that I shamelessly stole most of the cathedral from the same source, especially the prayers. I hereby acknowledge doing so; Zelazny is one of my favorite authors.*081

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Others might recognize Oracle Jones from the movie, "The Hallelujah Trail".@@PB**082

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You will find that this is not a quicky 30-minute kill & loot scenario, but you should be prepared to spend many hours working out the puzzles, in the spirit of the Great Underground Empire, or the Colossal Cave.*083

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: By my count, there are at least eight puzzles to be solved here. Several of them interlock, and several have nested minor puzzles that must be solved first.*084

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: I hope that you enjoy it.*085

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Tom Zuchowski

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: For the last day or so, you had been beset by feelings of uneasiness that you could not put a name to.*101

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: And so it happened that you searched through the rooms of the Main Hall for an itinerant seer by the name of Oracle Jones.*102

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Now, some say that Jones has no talent, but is merely a derelict cadging free whisky from the gullible.*103

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: But you know better. You have seen what he can do when he has had a good belt to clear his vision.@@PB**104

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You find him seated at a table near the back bar. "My friend!" he cries, "I have had a vision! I have news, my friend! News for you! Now, what was it..."*105

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: As he strains to remember, you catch him peeking at you from the corner of his eye. Without a word, you slap a gold piece on the bar, and without a word, the barkeep hands you a bottle of rye.*106

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Silently, you splash some into a glass and set it in front of him. In a shot Oracle grabs the glass and drains it in a single gulp. His eyes fly open!@@PB**107

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "I see it! I see it!" he cries. "It's a message from ol' Tokas! He's in a mess o' trouble!"*108

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Now, this is news; and even as Oracle Jones says it, you know with a catch in your throat that this is the source of the uneasiness that has plagued you.*109

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: He begins to strain again, struggling to see more, as he pushes the empty shotglass back to you. And without a word, you refill it.*110

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: He gulps it down, and again, his eyes fly open!@@PB**111

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Oracle gabbles, "Yes! Yes! I can see it clearly now! Tokas is in a bad way fer sure, an' he needs your help! He says to hurry!"*112

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: He's on a roll now. Quickly, you pour him another drink. Without looking down or even seeming to notice you, Oracle Jones knocks it back.*113

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: "He says, he says to come to the city of Lumen where he's set up shop! He says, look for him near the south gate! Hurry, he says!"@@PB**114

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: That's good enough for you. You set the bottle on the table in front of Oracle Jones, and without once having said a single word, turn and hurry away.*115

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: It sounds like Hokas Tokas is in real trouble.@@PB**116

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You throw a few weapons together, and force a quick march to the city of Lumen. It looks peaceful enough from outside, but when you pass through the open north gate -@@PB**117

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: You are instantly plunged into pitch darkness! You cannot move, but are held by an unseen, dark power! You can feel it pawing though your things.*118

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Though you cannot hear it, you can sense its thoughts: "Gold! You bring me gold, my pretty one! And what's this? Magic weapons? Oh, ho! Ho! Hoho! Hohohohohoho -"*119

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: In that instant you feel the familiar presence of the mind of Hokas Tokas. Your senses reel...

Collection.name: FreeUids
Collection.type: System.Collections.Generic.List`1[[System.Int64, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089]], mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089
